TextView.android:text: What can you do when all these things happen? Over time, these two pathologies have been constantly and diligently studied to see what can help improve the mental health of a person suffering from anxiety or depression.

Firstly, the benefits of therapy with a certified psychologist or psychotherapist are a wonderful help in managing your symptoms and the way you are thinking. It is very important to find a therapist with whom you feel you can communicate and who can help you on your journey with these issues.

Other things that have been proven to be helpful include certain relaxation techniques based on deep, abdominal breathing. There are multiple videos that can guide you through various abdominal or diaphragmatic breathing techniques, which can help calm you down when you are stressed or anxious.
Engaging in sports or any kind of outdoor physical activity is also beneficial for you. When we exercise, molecules called endorphins are released, which help improve our mood.
Spending time in outside and connecting with nature is another beneficial method. Studies indicate that spending time in nature helps reduce cortisol levels, the stress hormone.
Practicing activities such as yoga or meditation is also useful. They help you organize your thoughts and find the calm you need.
Last but not least, socializing with friends or family and participating in certain social events can help you overcome certain mental states and more easily fight these problems.
